Authors: Franck Stefani, Rodney H Jones, Tom W May
Title:
Cortinarius magenteiannulatus, a new species in a new
southern hemisphere clade related to the northern hemisphere section
Veneti of Cortinarius
Keywords:
ITS, rpb2, phylogeny, spores, systematic, taxonomy,
species delimitation
Abstract:
: A new species, Cortinarius magenteiannulatus, growing in
Eucalyptus forests in south-eastern Australia is described. Colour
pictures, macro and micro morphological data and scanning electron
microscopy of the spores are provided. Molecular analyses based on
sequencing the ITS rRNA regions and rpb2 protein-coding gene suggested a
strong molecular divergence of C. magenteiannulatus with its closest
known relatives and supported the monophyly of the new species within
Cortinarius. Cortinarius veronicae and C. veronicoides were found as the
two closest relatives to C. magenteiannulatus. Surprisingly, these three
species were recovered within a strongly supported monophyletic clade
that includes northern hemisphere species belonging to section
Veneti.
